question: What is Gilbert Livingston known for?

content.source_1: Gilbert Livingston (cricketer) Gilbert Vivian Livingston (born 22 November 1877 in the West Indies, death details unknown) was a West Indian cricketer who toured with the first West Indian touring side to England in 1900. Initially he was a reserve in the 1900 touring side but with a number of players dropping out he became a member of the team. He was described as a "very good bowler; quite the best player Jamaica can put forward". However he proved to be a disappointment and played in only two matches, against Warwickshire and Wiltshire. He was a member of Kensington and
content.source_2: Gilbert Livingston (legislator) Gilbert Livingston (December 17, 1742 â€“ September 14, 1806) was a lawyer who, in 1788, served as a delegate to the Poughkeepsie Convention where, despite having arrived at the convention as an Anti-Federalist, he ultimately voted to ratify the United States Constitution. Both before and after that ratification convention, he served in the New York Assembly, representing Dutchess County. Livingston had also been a member of the New York Provincial Congress. Gilbert was one of the thirteen children of Henry Livingston, Sr. and Susanna Conklin Livingston. Gilbert's father, Henry, was County Clerk in Dutchess County, as well

answer: A lawyer and a delegate to the Poughkeepsie Convention, and a member of the New York Assembly and the New York Provincial Congress
